Developer Terms of Use
des:
Logitech recommends you enable our other, newly updated “Harmony” skill. Both the “Harmony” skill and this “Harmony — Secondary Hub” skill offer similar capabilities. 
 
Harmony skill: 
“Alexa, turn on the TV” 
“Alexa, turn on Netflix” 
“Alexa, turn up the volume” 
“Alexa, pause” 
 
Harmony — Secondary Hub skill: 
“Alexa, ask Harmony to turn on the TV” 
“Alexa, ask Harmony to turn on Netflix” 
“Alexa, ask Harmony to turn up the volume” 
“Alexa, ask Harmony to pause” 
 
ADVANCED 
The “Harmony — Secondary Hub” skill allows you to set up a second Harmony Hub for independent control using this skill. It also supports adjusting how many volume up or down commands Harmony will send to your entertainment device when you say “increase the volume”. Say, “Alexa, ask Harmony to set my default volume units to 10” and Harmony will use this new default for both the “Harmony” and “Harmony — Secondary Hub” skill. 
 
Harmony — Secondary Hub skill for Amazon Alexa works with Logitech Harmony Elite, Harmony Companion and Harmony Hub; available at logitech.com/harmony. Set up your Harmony remote before enabling this skill. 
 
For additional information, visit myharmony.com/alexa
